article_title: Fans Pay Respects to Yogi Berra
article_text:
LITTLE FALLS, N.J.—Standing outside the Yogi Berra Museum and Learning Center on Wednesday, 11-year-old Aaron Burtone knelt and felt in the cement sidewalk the hand prints of the legendary Yankee catcher, who died Tuesday at age 90.

“I’ve watched a lot of tape of Yogi and he’s just a role model for everybody so I had to come and pay my respects,” said Burtone, a bat boy for the New Jersey Jackals, the independent team that plays in...
